metadata.title: CVE-2014-9679 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer underflow in the cupsRasterReadPixels function in filter/raster.cin CUPS before 2.0.2 allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact viaa malformed compressed raster file, which triggers a buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9679` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cups - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.5
cups-bsd - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.5
cups-client - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.5
cups-common - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.5
cups-core-drivers - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.5
cups-daemon - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.5
cups-ppdc - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.5
cups-server-common - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.5
libcups2 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.5
libcupscgi1 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.5
libcupsimage2 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.5
libcupsmime1 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.5
libcupsppdc1 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cups package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.7.2-0ubuntu1.5').
